entry.title: Avoid Windows network location permission prompt during casting startup
entry.content:
Creates an WinRT implementation of GetMacSsidMap() in

//chrome/browser/media/router/discovery/ to avoid network location

permission prompts on Win11 24H2. DiscoveryNetworkMonitor uses the

Windows OS API, WlanQueryInterface(), to get the SSID.



On Win11 24H2, Windows prompts for network location permission when apps

use WlanQueryInterface(). In addition to returning the SSID,

WlanQueryInterface() returns information that may be used to determine

network location like the BSSID of the WiFi access point.



This change creates a WinRT implementation of GetMacSsidMap() that uses

the WinRT API IWlanConnectionProfileDetails::GetConnectedSsid() instead

of WlanQueryInterface().

IWlanConnectionProfileDetails::GetConnectedSsid() does not prompt for

location permission because it does not return any additional

information beyond the SSID string.



To reduce risk, this change runs the Winrt code on new Windows Insider

builds only. Older versions of Windows continue using the

existing WlanQueryInterface() code.



Bug: 1502604

Change-Id: If85af43c31ea7d403b7902aab2c9a9b84c9caf8f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5034460

Reviewed-by: Takumi Fujimoto

Commit-Queue: Steve Becker

Reviewed-by: Brandon Maslen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257744}

entry.title: Allow conversion from base::span<T, N> to std::span<T, N> for const N
entry.content:
std::span(Range) constructor does not deduce N in the type system from

base::span so it constructs a std::span. We

want to ensure that any code that accepts std::span can be

passed a compatible base::span and it will implicitly convert.



Bug: 1490484, 40256238

Change-Id: I1ad8c0a490d94070eea98fbbf00e39380029c792

entry.title: Add logic to disable ::webkit-scrollbar styling based on web setting
entry.content:
This is the third of a series of 4 CLs implementing logic that could

allow users to disable custom scrollbar styling based on a web

preference. This is important from an accessibility perspective as

some scrollbars with custom styling can be too low-contrast because the

color contrast is not high enough or the width is too thin.



This CL adds the logic to disable ::webkit prefixed pseudo elements by

adding some new logic to ComputedStyle::HasCustomScrollbarStyles. It

also adds a new VirtualTestSuite `prefers-default-scrollbar-styles`.



Without a UI implementation or an entry in about:flags, there is no

way for users to actually access this setting at this time. But these

changes strive to make that possible for a future implementation.



Bug: 1012117

Change-Id: I882a4091ed7ee020e968a7f05b71d4d473bc4a95

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5194932

Commit-Queue: Evelynn Kaplan

Reviewed-by: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Reviewed-by: Alison Maher

entry.title: Estimate memory cost from Tint objects owned by GPUShaderModule
entry.content:
This helps reduce GPU process memory from blowing up when JS objects

aren't being cleaned up promptly enough. This incurs a small overhead

for extra GC (maybe 1-5% on shader-heavy tests?) but keeps GPU process

memory usage somewhat more stable.



We may actually want to adjust this estimate higher - the GC overhead is

unrealistically low before this change. But we can start with a safer

lower number and watch the impact on OOM frequency in automated tests

(see bug). Ideally we could use a real estimate from Tint itself.



Bug: dawn:2367

Change-Id: Id82375fd6550753590bb17d64d382e76f86f0cf6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5235901

Reviewed-by: Austin Eng

Commit-Queue: Kai Ninomiya

entry.title: [exo] Implement zaura_output_manager_v2 protocol server-side
entry.content:
See follow-up CL for exo tests crrev.com/c/5247526.



This CL introduces the zaura_output_manager_v2 protocol to the

aura-shell extension and implements this server-side.



At a high level the protocol uses the global output name to

communicate atomic output config updates without excessive

server<->client round-trips.



Key additions



- OutputConfigurationChange

Struct wrapping added/removed/changed output globals



- AuraOutputManagerV2

Responsible for sending zaura_output_manager_v2 events to bound

clients.

OutputController composes this class to coordinate event

dispatch in response to output configuration changes.



Output configuration updates are communicated to bound clients via

wl_registry.global - output additions

wl_registry.global_remove - output removals

zaura_output_manager_v2.* - output metric changes

zaura_output_manager_v2.done - end of atomic config change



There are two important cases to consider

- Steady state (output changes after client has bound global)

Add / remove / modify events communicated normally

- Initial bind

The client will have already received add events for

active outputs. To complete the atomic config update

AuraOutputManagerV2 sends all active output metrics

immediately after bind.



See go/atomic-output-configuration for more details.



Bug: 1427019, 1408304, 1518335

Change-Id: I1421b34d06373b5e5be1536cd8738f5316265002

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199307

Commit-Queue: Thomas Lukaszewicz

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257715}

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Ensure PDFs have loaded in TestPdfViewerStreamManager
entry.content:
In TestPdfViewerStreamManager::WaitUntilPdfLoaded(), wait until the PDF

extension and content has finished loading by using

pdf_extension_test_util::EnsurePDFHasLoaded(). The old version of

WaitUntilPdfLoaded() only waited until the PDF content frame finished

navigating, which was insufficient for some PDF tests.



Change WaitUntilPdfLoaded() and WaitUntilPdfLoadedInFirstChild() to

return the load result.



Now that WaitUntilPdfLoaded() properly waits, use it in

PDFExtensionTestBase::EnsurePDFHasLoadedWithValidFrameTree().

Cardboard tests were failing with:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: no static or non-static method

"Lcom/google/cardboard/sdk/QrCodeCaptureActivity;.nativeIncrementDeviceParamsChangedCount()V"



This is due to the change we made in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253758



We no longer just apply this keep rule to all natives, so places which

rely on natives being not renamed must specify that themselves.

entry.title: Don't invalidate parts after thumb position change
entry.content:
The CL prevents Fluent scrollbar track part from being invalidated

after thumb position changes. Aura scrollbars change arrow buttons

color when the scroll offset changes from and to the min/max scroll

offset. Fluent scrollbars do not change the arrow buttons color

in this case. Thus, we can avoid the redundant invalidation.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Modify EnsurePDFHasLoaded() to support OOPIF
entry.content:
pdf_extension_test_util::EnsurePDFHasLoaded() will soon be unable to

support OOPIF, since postMessage() support is being restricted. Modify

it to be able to support OOPIF by running a script directly in the

extension frame.



The existing version of EnsurePDFHasLoaded() accesses the PDF

element and sends a postMessage(), which will no longer be accessible

when shadow DOM is added in https://crrev.com/c/5072998. However,

postMessage() will still be accessible if a script is injected into the

PDF extension frame.



Note that TestPdfViewerStreamManager::WaitUntilPdfLoaded() is still

needed, since the new version of EnsurePDFHasLoaded() must directly run

the script in the extension host. The extension host must exist by the

the time EnsurePDFHasLoaded() is used.



Bug: 40268279

Change-Id: Ica67639715ff20e0c1db15670e98c1d9f3f625ab

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5242080

entry.title: App Management: Add boilerplate Platform-specific subclasses
entry.content:
This boilerplate establishes separate PageHandler instances for

Windows/Mac/Linux and ChromeOS. Once these are in place, we can begin

moving platform-specific code from the common PageHandler into the

relevant subclass.



Note that in the long-term, we might be able to remove the common Base

class, and just have two implementations of the same interface. In the

meantime, though, this allows us to gradually/safely refactor code

without duplicating it.



Bug: b/317152362

entry.title: [wptrunner] Allow any subtests on test timeout
entry.content:
This matches the `run_web_tests.py` behavior. `run_wpt_tests.py`

previously tried to emulate this in the expectation translation layer,

but handling subtest results on test timeout is fundamentally a decision

that can only be made at runtime. Hook into the testrunner machinery to

do so.



See also: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/44134

entry.title: Sync the limited entropy trial's group assignment between Ash and
entry.content:
LaCrOS.



The client_id and the low entropy source values are already synced

between the Ash Chrome client and the LaCrOS client. This makes sure

that these clients have the same field trial assignments and are treated

as the same client for their metrics. For the same reason, we need these

clients to have the same assignment for the limited entropy synthetic

trial, and this CL adds the syncing of the randomization seed from Ash

Chrome to LaCrOS.



Note that this is a one-way sync (i.e. Ash Chrome generates the value,

and LaCrOS receives, and injects the value into the synthetic trial) and

nothing is being synced from LaCrOS to Ash Chrome. Furthermore, the

valid range for the seed of the limited entropy synthetic trial is

modified to be [1, 100], which used to be [0, 100) - in order to avoid 0

being a valid value. Therefore, when there is not a seed to be synced,

the mojom object will contain a 0 value and it will not be injected into

the trial object on the LaCrOS client.



Bug: b/316412206

Change-Id: Ibab0b19c9868748c45010361cdfa5dff929b6719

the price drop if eligible.

entry.title: [Tab Groups] Fix root ID to be the tab ID of a tab in the group
entry.content:
All tabs in a tab group share a root ID. This root ID is supposed to be

the tab ID of one of the tabs in the group.



There are some scenarios like the one highlighted in b/41496085 that

result in this assumption being violated.



This CL makes a change so that when tab state is initialized we run a

simple fixup process where for each tab group we check if any of its

tabs have a tab ID that matches the root ID it is using. If a tab ID

that matches the root ID is found nothing is done. Otherwise the tab ID

of the first tab in the group replaces the root ID of all tabs in the

group so that the assumption that the root ID is the tab ID of one of

the tabs in the group holds true.



This CL also adds a histogram to measure the severity of this problem

to hopefully drive this issue towards 0 over time.



Bug: b/40260089

Change-Id: I6ece28755d24672ffe62fca654526b319914aac6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273029

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

entry.title: Use GetCurrentDefault() for BufferingBytesConsumer::CreateWithDelay().
entry.content:
We assume that the root cause of TSan issue is running timeout timer

in the different thread. To avoid that, we intend to run the timeout

timer in the default thread, which is usually be the current task

runner, instead of running it in the given thread, which may not be

the current task runner.



Additional change:

- To ensure the methods are called from the same thread, all methods

starts to DCHECK the sequence.



Change-Id: Ia77682e00d81a65f342f613cdd25a94582ff1053

entry.title: WebUI: Auto-generate Lit shared styles from equivalent Polymer styles.
entry.content:
Update css_to_wrapper() to handle any files ending with the "_lit.css"

suffix in a special way, by extracting the CSS content from the

equivalent Polymer file instead of the "*_lit.css" file itself.



This way the Polymer file acts as a canonical source of truth, while

still allowing both Lit and Polymer elements to use the same styles at

runtime.



This is done to avoid duplicating those styles during the Lit migration,

and eliminate the chances for such styles to diverge. For example the

ongoing CR2023 cleanup will not need to worry about updating duplicate

styles.



Bug: 40943652

entry.title: Switch GPU fuzzy threshold type
entry.content:
Switches all the GPU pixel tests that have inexact matching enabled to

use pixel_per_channel_delta_threshold for fuzzy comparisons instead of

pixel_delta_threshold.



The latter was the only option available when Gold was initially

adopted, but the former is more in line with what we care about for GPU

testing.



Previously, the theshold was compared to the sum of differences across

all channels. Now, the threshold is compared to the diff in each

individual channel. The thresholds have been adjusted to be 1/2-1/3 of

their original values accordingly, and can be adjusted further if we

find certain tests need it.



Bug: 1523027

Change-Id: I2c990d8fe7458f4f0af4f34771db7781e6b6a783

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Wait for tab state initialization with Hub
entry.content:
Before Hub the tab switcher would wait for tab state to be initialized

before showing. There were some edgecases where this could still crash

such as switching to incognito mode or opening the tab selection

editor.



Post Hub we didn't implement this wait behavior leading to crashes and

partially loaded tab switcher UI. Fix this by waiting for tab state

initialization before showing anything.



Originally, this CL added the refresh post tab state restore logic:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5246845.

That logic is valid here as well, but now we don't even attempt to

show the tabs in the tab switcher until the restoreCompleted signal.



This CL also prevents the "Select tabs" menu from being available

before tab state is restored which was a source of crashes and bugs.



Also add a histogram to track how long between showing the tab

switcher and the UI being functional takes.



Bug: b/324017468

Change-Id: I4d4a592a06fcb230f9387b5069fe376350cbca0c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273207

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

entry.title: Shuffle some tests around on -dev builders
entry.content:
https://luci-milo-dev.appspot.com/p/chromium/g/chromium.dev/console



Those builders are essentially copies of main waterfall bots we have

on prod, but running -dev instances of LUCI services/binaries. So

they can theoretically provide a useful signal for things.



But neglect has left them in varying degrees of perma-red. So this

removes/reshards some of their tests to improve things.



It:

- adds 2 more shards to interactive_ui_tests on windows since 1 shard

isn't enough

- removes content_browsertests and interactive_ui_tests on mac since

mac capacity on -dev is pretty low, and they can't run all those

tests



Bug: 324075865

entry.title: [Extensions] Simplify ExtensionWebContentsObserver::Initialize()
entry.content:
At the time ExtensionWebContentsObserver::Initialize() is called, the

only frame that should exist is the main frame. Currently, there's

logic to initialize any other frames, but this should be unnecessary

(and would indicate Initialize() was called too late).



Simplify this to ensure only the main frame exists.

entry.title: Initialize NativeThemeWin web instance with the system color info
entry.content:
This CL resolves a bug that prevents some users from seeing web

contents in High Contrast themes. Prior to CL:5081941, which improved

the way the web native theme is updated, the web instance for

NativeThemeWin was initialized with the system color info

unconditionally. The CL introduced conditions that resulted in the

NativeThemeWin web instance not picking up the right states when those

conditions are not met.



This CL fixes this by reverting back to the previous behavior of

unconditionally initializing the Windows native theme web instance

with the system color info.



Bug: 323898907

entry.title: ozone: Remove RDing FootSwitch1F1 from keyboard blocklist
entry.content:
The RDing FootSwitch1F1 shares its product ID & vendor ID with

legitimate keyboards. It should be removed from the keyboard blocklist

so that these devices aren't prevented from identifying as keyboards.

Project imposter will be able to flag the RDing FootSwitch1F1 as a

non-keyboard device.
